cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of allocating goods to agents to maximize fairness, which is a central topic in computational game theory (cs.GT). The algorithmic techniques used in the paper involve linear programming and approximation algorithms, which are fundamental tools in theoretical computer science (cs.DS). The problem of allocating goods to agents is a classic problem in artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and the paper proposes a new algorithm for this problem. The paper also involves the analysis of the approximability of the problem, which is a common theme in theoretical computer science (cs.LG). Finally, the paper investigates a special case of the problem that can be cast as a graph edge orientation problem, which is a topic in combinatorics and graph theory (cs.CC).
